WILD3810: Plant and animal populations

Spring 2020

schedule.Rmd

LECTURE SCHEDULE

Lecture
Week (dates) M W
Unit 1: Dynamics of unstructured populations
1 (Jan. 18 & 20) No class Intro to WILD3810
2 (Jan. 25 & 27) Abundance Abundance (continued)
3 (Feb. 1 & 3) Density-independent population growth Stochastic population dynamics
4 (Feb. 8 & 10) Density-dependent population growth Dynamics of small populations
5 (Feb. 15 & 17) President’s Day - no class Buffer
6 (Feb. 22 & 24) Exam 1 Review Exam 1
Unit 2: Dynamics of structured populations
7 (Mar. 1 & 3) Life tables Survival estimation
8 (Mar. 8 & 10) Reproduction Matrix models
9 (Mar. 15 & 17) Matrix models (continued) Age-structured dynamics
10 (Mar. 22 & 24) Sensitivity and elasticity Life-history diversity
11 (Mar. 29 & 31) Review Exam 2
Unit 3: Spatial dynamics
12 (Apr. 5 & 7) Review Exam 2 Metapopulation dynamics
13 (Apr. 12 & 14) Metapopulation dynamics (continued) Source-sink dynamics
Unit 4: Species interactions
14 (Apr. 19 & 21) Competition Predator-prey dynamics
15 (Apr. 26 & 28) Review No class

LAB SCHEDULE

Week (date) Topic
Unit 1: Dynamics of unstructured populations
1 (Jan. 18) No lab
2 (Jan. 25) Introduction to R/R Markdown
3 (Feb. 1) Introduction to R (cont.)/Abundance estimation
4 (Feb. 8) Introduction to R/Modeling population growth
5 (Feb. 15) President’s Day - no lab
6 (Feb. 22) Modeling population growth (continued)
Unit 2: Dynamics of structured populations
7 (Mar. 1) Population viability analysis
8 (Mar. 8) Life tables
9 (Mar. 15) Survival estimation
10 (Mar. 22) Matrix population projections
11 (Mar. 29) Elasticity analysis and comparison of life history strategies
Unit 3: Spatial dynamics
12 (Apr. 5) Metapopulation models
13 (Apr. 12) Occupancy models
Unit 4: Species interactions
14 (Apr. 19) Compensatory predation
15 (Apr. 26) No lab
